title: Test failure: quarkus-integration-test-logging-gelf fails with podman
body:
### Describe the bug

I am working on a CI run which uses podman, and it has shown several failing tests. https://github.com/holly-cummins/quarkus/actions/runs/4844611295/jobs/8632987478 is an example run with failures. https://github.com/holly-cummins/quarkus/tree/podman-build has the (messy) workflow code.

Note that Iâ€™ve disabled this test when the CI is running with Podman, to keep the build clean. As part of the fix for this, the `IS_PODMAN` guard should be removed from the `pom.xml`. 

### Actual behavior

```
2023-04-30T17:57:00.0138360Z [INFO] Compiling 2 source files with javac [debug deprecation release 11] to target/test-classes
2023-04-30T17:57:00.2033528Z [INFO] 
2023-04-30T17:57:00.2034845Z [INFO] --- docker-maven-plugin:0.42.1:stop (docker-start) @ quarkus-integration-test-logging-gelf ---
2023-04-30T17:57:01.0469549Z [INFO] 
2023-04-30T17:57:01.0470852Z [INFO] --- docker-maven-plugin:0.42.1:start (docker-start) @ quarkus-integration-test-logging-gelf ---
2023-04-30T17:57:20.1073073Z [INFO] DOCKER> Pulled docker.io/elastic/logstash:7.16.3 in 18 seconds 
2023-04-30T17:57:20.1363289Z [INFO] DOCKER> [docker.io/elastic/elasticsearch:7.16.3] "elasticsearch": Start container bae3bcf9c63f
2023-04-30T17:57:21.6211939Z [ERROR] DOCKER> Error occurred during container startup, shutting down...
2023-04-30T17:57:21.6213657Z [ERROR] DOCKER> I/O Error [Unable to start container id [bae3bcf9c63f] : {"cause":"OCI runtime error","message":"crun: the requested cgroup controller `cpu` is not available: OCI runtime error","response":500} (Internal Server Error: 500)]
2023-04-30T17:57:21.6215594Z [INFO] 
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6816528Z [ERROR] Failed to execute goal io.fabric8:docker-maven-plugin:0.42.1:start (docker-start) on project quarkus-integration-test-logging-gelf: I/O Error: Unable to start container id [b44bdc26ab68] : {"cause":"OCI runtime error","message":"crun: the requested cgroup controller `cpu` is not available: OCI runtime error","response":500} (Internal Server Error: 500) -> [Help 2]
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6817795Z org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal io.fabric8:docker-maven-plugin:0.42.1:start (docker-start) on project quarkus-integration-test-logging-gelf: I/O Error
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6818526Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.doExecute2 (MojoExecutor.java:375)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6819217Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.doExecute (MojoExecutor.java:351)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6819769Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute (MojoExecutor.java:215)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6820311Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute (MojoExecutor.java:171)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6820912Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute (MojoExecutor.java:163)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6821546Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject (LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:117)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6822352Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject (LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:81)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6823342Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.builder.singlethreaded.SingleThreadedBuilder.build (SingleThreadedBuilder.java:56)
2023-05-02T15:46:29.6824056Z     at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleStarter.execute 
```
### How to Reproduce?

Reproduction note: I haven't been able to reproduce this locally on mac with podman 4.03.
With the latest mac version of podman `4.4.4`, I get a different failure, 

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal io.fabric8:docker-maven-plugin:0.42.1:start (docker-start) on project quarkus-integration-test-logging-gelf: I/O Error: Unable to create container for [docker.io/elastic/logstash:7.16.3] : {"cause":"image not known","message":"no such image: docker.io/elastic/logstash:7.16.3: image not known","response":404} (Not Found: 404) -> [Help 1]
```

Picking up my branch to reproduce on CI should work, or running locally on linux with a podman engine of `4.5`. 


## Environment Info
